sub_topic: Calculation of Carnot efficiency of a heat engine
message_1: A heat engine operates between two heat reservoirs at temperatures of 500 K and 300 K. What is the Carnot efficiency of this engine?
message_2:
The Carnot efficiency is the maximum possible efficiency for a heat engine operating between two heat reservoirs at temperatures T1 (higher temperature) and T2 (lower temperature). It is given by the formula:

Carnot efficiency = 1 - (T2 / T1)

In this case, T1 = 500 K and T2 = 300 K. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Carnot efficiency = 1 - (300 K / 500 K) = 1 - 0.6 = 0.4

So, the Carnot efficiency of this heat engine is 0.4, or 40%.
